channel.title: Good things about Vista
channel.description: just wondering what are the positives and negatives about windows vista, please do post positives as well.

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

If you have a 64bit processor do not bother with the 64bit version of windows vista, get the 32bit it runs VERY fast. As fast as xp ran far me.
Even though i never use windows anymore, my loading times now that i switched to a 32bit version of vista are > 30 seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @lordslayer565 lordslayer565
item.description:
@lordslayer565 wrote:

Good: Direct X 10, Cool Skin, compatibility mode, 3D flip effect (There’s more I just can think of them)

Bad: A big RAM consumer, Bugs, lots of Bugs, shit loads of Bugs

My overall experince with vista: Bearable (6/10)

Btw: I’m running Vista home edition so I don’t have most of the somewhat cool things that home with the others.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Ohh wow. I went on my friend’s laptop, and it had Vista. It was hella slow man and I was wondering why. It was slow in comparison to my computer, and my computer is wrecked due to me being an arsehole and not taking proper care of it.

Now I can let him know why it’s slow, and rub it in. I’ll try to keep open minded though since it seems there are some good sides to Vista from your comments.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:22, topic:161188”]FYI: DX10 cards dont support DX10.1

so go buy a new gfx card, yet again.[/quote]

Hehe. They try to cover it up too: http://www.next-gen.biz/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=6824&Itemid=2

Apparently, DX10.1 will be released with Vista SP1 and is “supported” by DX10 cards, but isn’t “fully functional”, which sounds suspicious to me.

One of the comments on the news article I found funny:

To get this straight - DirectX10.1 will support my DX10 graphics card, but my DX10 graphics card will not support DX10.1. *sigh* MS hasn't 'written off' any fears - they have simply said 'it's not a spade, it's a pointy ended shovel intended for digging!'. All you early adopters out there, yes your card is now obsolete.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

exps35:

Not to mention the numerous reports of hardware not being compatible with vista at all.

Older computers/hardware, yeah.
But computer manufacturers have started to build computers made to ‘handle’ vista, i guess mine was built something like that since mine can run vista as easy as it does with xp.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“killerman93, post:18, topic:161188”]All the things you qouted their, are wrong.
Firstly, Vista takes 11.7 GB with numerous different language packs I chose to instal.
Secondly, Vista loads like a flash and shuts down even faster then XP unless I just got a update.
Thirdly, explorer.exe is way better in Vista, it’s got aero, the sexiest skin around. Plus the interface is the same, if not better because the search performs faster.
Fourthly, program support is easy, you go to the xxx.exe itself, and change the compatibility mode, just like in XP.
Fifthly, wtf do you mean by data murderer?

Yes, Vista is good, but XP’s BIOS support is much better. I run both and personally like Vista more as an OS.[/quote]

Clearly you didn’t understand half of what he was trying to say.

Continuous hdd usage != large hdd size taken up.

Many reports state Vista is slower than XP. Unless you have some hard evidence, it remains subjective. And even if you do have hard evidence, it may just be for your computer.

As I said before, an OS isn’t a fuckbuddy. They have prostitutes for that. Get your thing done with them, and go back to a real operating system. Furthermore, I gotta say Leopard and Tiger look better than Aero.

Does compatibility mode work with EVERYTHING in Vista that used to work for XP?

Not entirely sure what he meant by data murderer.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

It depends which kind of vista you have : home, preminium, business, and ultimate.

On the laptop I have preminium, and on cable comp I have ultimate.

There are lots of bugs which will be fixed later hopefully.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @killerman93 killerman93
item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

[quote=“Rajae, post:16, topic:161188”]Positives:
null

Negatives:
Continuous hard drive usage, Slow boot up and shut down, explorer.exe is shittier than windows XP, poor program support, data murderer.[/quote]

All the things you qouted their, are wrong.
Firstly, Vista takes 11.7 GB with numerous different language packs I chose to instal.
Secondly, Vista loads like a flash and shuts down even faster then XP unless I just got a update.
Thirdly, explorer.exe is way better in Vista, it’s got aero, the sexiest skin around. Plus the interface is the same, if not better because the search performs faster.
Fourthly, program support is easy, you go to the xxx.exe itself, and change the compatibility mode, just like in XP.
Fifthly, wtf do you mean by data murderer?

Yes, Vista is good, but XP’s BIOS support is much better. I run both and personally like Vista more as an OS.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:10, topic:161188”]Positives:
Will be supported in the future much better than older operating systems such as xp

Negatives:
Uses up more memory than most, if not all other operating systems (although i see no difference in speed or computer performance when running it).[/quote]

Actually, in 2010, Windows are releasing Windows 7, by the time they’ve fixed all the bugs, a new Windows will be out.

Read full topic

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Silver Lining, post:5, topic:161188”][quote author=ninja nub link=topic=219431.msg1903135#msg1903135 date=1196248610]
Positives: it earns bill gates more money
[/quote]Seriously, when your only positive is actually negative… Why would it be good that you’re lining the bank of a tyrant?[/quote]Actually Bill Gates isn’t leading the company, so all the money won’t go to him. Besides, Gates is not a real capitalist since he’s donating almost all of his money to various research/help funds when he dies.
I’d call him a hero.

Anyways, i don’t see any positives in vista really. All i’ve seen from it is bugs, and the design doesn’t appeal to me at all.

Read full topic

item.description:
@tL wrote:

Positives:
Will be supported in the future much better than older operating systems such as xp

Negatives:
Uses up more memory than most, if not all other operating systems (although i see no difference in speed or computer performance when running it).

item.title: Good things about Vista
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Positives: UAC, 64-bit support, BitLocker, visuals, security.

Negatives: Restrictive, unsupported.

You can tweak the settings to disable UAC and balloon tips.

Read full topic
